edu.eur.absa.model

Class Word

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.eur.absa.model.DataEntity
      • edu.eur.absa.model.Word
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DataEntity>

    public class Word
extends DataEntity
    A Word is the atomic unit of a Document. It contains only the most basic information about a word: its original textual representation, its order within the Document, including links to the previous and next Words, and offset information that can be useful when reconstructing the original data set with extra annotations (e.g., for submitting to competitions, benchmarks, etc.)
    Author:
    Kim Schouten

    • Constructor Detail

      • Word

        public Word(java.lang.String word,
            int startOffset,
            Span textualUnit,
            Dataset dataset)

        Creates a basic Word object, using the length of word to compute the endOffset. It links this Word object to its containing Dataset.

        This is the ideal way of creating the first Word for a new textual unit.
        Parameters:
        word -
        startOffset -
        textualUnit -
        dataset -

      • Word

        public Word(java.lang.String word,
            int startOffset,
            Word previousWord)

        Creates a basic Word object, using the length of word to compute the endOffset. It links this Word object to previousWord and this Word object is set as nextWord of previousWord. It also sets the Document to the document value of previousWord.

        This is the preferred way of creating Words, as it automatically creates the links between Words.

        Setting the previousWord parameter to null will result in a NullPointerException.

        Parameters:
        word -
        startOffset -
        previousWord -

      • getStartOffset

        public int getStartOffset()
        This is the start offset of this word, in terms of characters, within some textual unit (e.g., sentence or document), depending on the source data. This information can be useful to reconstruct a valid data file for evaluation/benchmark purposes
        Returns:

      • getEndOffset

        public int getEndOffset()
        This is the end offset of this word, in terms of characters, within some textual unit (e.g., sentence or document), depending on the source data. This information can be useful to reconstruct a valid data file for evaluation/benchmark purposes
        Returns:

      • getWord

        public java.lang.String getWord()
        Return the original word as first encountered in the source data. Can be useful to reconstruct a valid data file for evaluation/benchmark purposes. In normal life, one would probably grab one of the annotation in Span wordSpan.
        Returns:

      • getOrder

        public int getOrder()
        Return the order of this Word in its original textual unit (e.g., sentence or document), depending on the source data.
        Returns:

      • getTextualUnit

        public Span getTextualUnit()
        Description copied from class: DataEntity
        Return the textual unit this Span appears in. By definition, all Words within a Span must originate from the same textual unit. Textual unit can be a document, or basically any piece of independent text. Word order is counted per textual unit.
        Overrides:
        getTextualUnit in class DataEntity
        Returns:

      • resetOrder

        public void resetOrder()
        If the order of words is changed (by adding or removing a word somewhere), it needs to be updated Not only in the Word objects, but also in all of the Spans that contain this word.
